summary: The implementation adds 50 Indian Constitution laws with complete explanations through a data initialization system. The backend was updated with an initializeLaws method that populates laws on first load, and the frontend includes a new initialLaws.ts data file containing 50 law entries. The implementation preserves the 51-law capacity, maintains the burgundy/gold theme, and doesn't modify the immutable frontend paths specified in constraints.

hallucinated_features.description: Auto-initialization system with LawInitializer component that automatically populates laws on first app load
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest only asks to 'Add 50 laws' but does not specify that they should be automatically initialized on app startup. The implementation added a complete initialization system including LawInitializer.tsx component, useInitializeLaws.ts hook, and initializeLaws backend method.

hallucinated_features.description: Validation logic in initializeLaws that requires exactly 51 entries and prevents re-initialization
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest does not specify validation requirements or re-initialization prevention logic. The implementation added guards checking for laws.size() != 0 and initialLaws.size() != 51.

hallucinated_features.description: Loading UI indicator during law initialization
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest does not mention any loading state or UI feedback during initialization. The LawInitializer component includes a fixed position loading indicator with spinner and message.
